Momocs
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Layered shape and multivariate plots with grindr

Filters (ala dplyr) on Momocs objects

Return shapes with matching conditions, from the $fac. See examples and ?dplyr::filter.

filter(.data, ...)

Arguments

.data

a Coo, Coe, PCA object
...

logical conditions

Value

a Momocs object of the same class.

Details

dplyr verbs are maintained.

See also

Other handling functions: arrange, at_least, chop, combine, dissolve, mutate, rename, rescale, rm_harm, rm_uncomplete, rw_fac, sample_frac, sample_n, select, slice, table

Examples

olea
#> An Opn object with: 
#>  - $coo: 210 open outlines (99 +/- 4 coordinates)
#>  - $fac: 4 classifiers:
#>      'var' (factor 4): Aglan, Cypre, MouBo1, PicMa.
#>      'domes' (factor 2): cult, wild.
#>      'view' (factor 2): VD, VL.
#>      'ind' (factor 30): O1, O10, O11, O12, O13, O14, O15, O16, O17, O18, O19 ... + 19 more.
# we retain on dorsal views
filter(olea, view=="VD")
#> An Opn object with: 
#>  - $coo: 120 open outlines (99 +/- 3 coordinates)
#>  - $fac: 4 classifiers:
#>      'var' (factor 4): Aglan, Cypre, MouBo1, PicMa.
#>      'domes' (factor 2): cult, wild.
#>      'view' (factor 1): VD.
#>      'ind' (factor 30): O1, O10, O11, O12, O13, O14, O15, O16, O17, O18, O19 ... + 19 more.
# only dorsal views and Aglan+PicMa varieties
filter(olea, view=="VD", var %in% c("Aglan", "PicMa"))
#> An Opn object with: 
#>  - $coo: 60 open outlines (100 +/- 2 coordinates)
#>  - $fac: 4 classifiers:
#>      'var' (factor 2): Aglan, PicMa.
#>      'domes' (factor 1): cult.
#>      'view' (factor 1): VD.
#>      'ind' (factor 30): O1, O10, O11, O12, O13, O14, O15, O16, O17, O18, O19 ... + 19 more.
# we create an id column and retain the 120 first shapes
olea %>% mutate(id=1:length(olea)) %>% filter(id > 120)
#> An Opn object with: 
#>  - $coo: 90 open outlines (99 +/- 4 coordinates)
#>  - $fac: 5 classifiers:
#>      'var' (factor 2): MouBo1, PicMa.
#>      'domes' (factor 2): cult, wild.
#>      'view' (factor 2): VD, VL.
#>      'ind' (factor 30): O1, O10, O11, O12, O13, O14, O15, O16, O17, O18, O19 ... + 19 more.
#>      'id' (factor 90): 121, 122, 123, 124, 125, 126, 127, 128, 129, 130, 131 ... + 79 more.
